events.text:
Made by Viridino Studios (@ViridinoStudios)

Mateus Ferreira - Programmer
Twitter: @BonzerKitten
E-mail: ferreiramoreiramateus@gmail.com

Wesley Andrade - Artist
Twitter: @andrart7
E-mail: wesleymatos1989@gmail.com

Made with the support of patrons on https://www.patreon.com/viridinostudios
How far the player needs to move the analog stick before it starts to be recognized by the game.
The default screen refresh rate for testing.
How far or close the camera will be from the player.

children.text: Reset global variables to prevent traces from previous sessions.
Setup the player by adding its graphics to the collider as a child.
Receive and store input from the player to be used later in many situations.
Toggle input left.
Toggle input right.
Toggle input up.
Toggle input down.
Calculate both axis and looking angle based on the player input.
Move the player horizontally based on its horizontal axis.
Simulate player jump.
Only allow animation related stuff if the platform behavior is enabled, which means the player is currently controllable.
Mirror the player graphics based on its horizontal axis.
Change the animation states depending on what the player is currently doing.
Walk animation.
Idle animation.
Jump animation.
Fall animation.
Spawn different types of dust particles depending on the player actions.
Walking dust.
Landing dust.
Jumping dust.
Leave a trail of "clones" behind the player while he's jumping.
Activate the elevator sequence if the player collides with it.

actions.text: Snap the player position to match the elevator center.
Update the elevator animation speed, so it starts flashing.

children.text: Extend each elevator rail in order.
Once the player is properly centered, add it as a child of the elevator, so they stay together and move the elevator up.
Only allow arm cannon related stuff if the platform behavior is enabled, which means the player is currently controllable.
Shoot a bullet from the player's arm cannon.
Destroy the bullet whenever it hits a wall.
Spawn explosion particles when the bullet is destroyed.
Destroy the particles after their animation is done to prevent CPU overload.
Create a trail effect behind the bullet.

actions.text: Adjust the trail angle to point towards the bullet.
Adjust the trail width to reach the bullet last position.

children.text: Update de bullet last position.
How fast the camera will track the player position.
How much time it takes to move from room to room.
In how many parts the transition time will be divided. The first and last parts are used to turn the fog on and off, anything in between is left for the player walking animation.
Instantly set the scroll X and Y positions to match the player position, so it's not possible to see anything out of boundaries.
Constantly move the scroll X and Y positions towards the player, but with interpolated values this time, so it's much smoother.

parameters.x: lerp(scrollx, (clamp(PlayerCollision.X, CameraZone.X + (OriginalViewportWidth / 2), CameraZone.X + CameraZone.Width - (OriginalViewportWidth / 2))), TrackingSpeed * TARGETFRAMERATE * dt)
parameters.y: lerp(scrolly, (clamp(PlayerCollision.Y, CameraZone.Y + (OriginalViewportHeight / 2), CameraZone.Y + CameraZone.Height - (OriginalViewportHeight / 2))), TrackingSpeed * TARGETFRAMERATE * dt)

children.text: Destroy any bullet that collides with a hatch.
If the hatch heath is higher than zero, decrease it by one.
If after taking damage, the hatch heath still is higher than zero, spawn a flash effect to make the shot more impactful.
If the hatch heath is finally equal or lower than zero, change its animation.
If the player collides with an open hatch, start a transition sequece.

actions.text: Move the player through the hatch.
Close the hatch after all animations are over.
Show the fog on top of everything except for the player and the hatch.
Hide the fog after all animations are over.

children.text: Make sure the player is using the correct animation by updating it one more time here.
Reset the hatch properties by setting its animation to close and its heath to three.
Hide the fog.
Give control back to the player.
Restart the game.
Close the game.
